content: The Cross-Off Median Method transforms histogram confusion: Cross off equal frequencies from both ends until middle found. Student calculated mode (highest bar=15) instead of median. Visual technique makes abstract concept concrete. 'Keep crossing off until you can't anymore - that's your median.'

Error pattern documentation reveals truth: 'I think that's something I really need to work on... I kinda try to speed it up.' Most mistakes from rushing not knowledge gaps. Jenny prescribes: 'Go a little bit slower the first step... be more intentional with every number.'

Guest speaker pivot for Empowering AI: 'Bring in someone who works in AI... OpenAI, Google AI.' Email outreach failing with only 3 signups. People come for celebrities, stay for content. Pivot from mass outreach to targeted value creation.

Mistake vulnerability normalized: Jenny says 'Actually, wait. No, no, no' when solving. Makes errors acceptable. Technical needs shared: 'Give me 1 min plug in my computer.' Elite student has basic human needs. Creates safe learning environment.

Visual teaching shift for inscribed figures: Student confused about diagonal vs radius. Jenny switches to drawing diagrams live. '45-45-90 triangle properties' discovered through guided visualization. Side = 15/4, diagonal = 15/4 × √2. Abstract geometry becomes concrete.

SAT preparation architecture: Practice in living room not bedroom, parent as timer/grader for realism, label everything ('2015 actual population = 7.35'), verify word problems through substitution. Environment + process + verification = improvement.

Session deliverables: Median calculation method mastered, inscribed figure relationships understood, 20+ problems solved collaboratively, Bank of America application started (2 per state competitive), test strategy shifted from speed to intentionality.

Screen sharing pedagogy deployed: Live diagram creation for geometry, student controls screen for agency, drawing tools for visual learning. Extra session added flexibly: 'Tomorrow 7:30 PM for scholarship essays.' Responsive scheduling to needs.

Opening efficiency shows maturity: 'I think we get straight into it.' Skips pleasantries comfortably. Strategic transparency: 'Only choose about 2 people per state' for Bank of America. Sets realistic expectations while encouraging effort.

Socratic geometry teaching deployed: 'What type of triangle is this?' leads student to discover 45-45-90 properties themselves. Self-discovered knowledge sticks better than told information. Bicycle problem: 'Walk through hour-by-hour' reveals conceptual clarity through process.
